website_summaries.verdict: A good option for light jobs around the house, but it's not suitable as a drill.
pros: Convenient for assembling toys or light furniture
cons: Power switch is in an awkward position
Not much power for more than easy, predrilled screws

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool! It works great and is easy to use. The only thing I didn't like was that I ordered the drill bits that Amazon suggested be bought with it. They had the round end and they don't work. It needs the hexagon end bits.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, weak"power" tool
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed and this tool. This was Amazon's choice for a rechargeable electric screwdriver and it is weak. It also recommended drill bits and screwdriver tips to get with it and they don't fit. Maybe I need some attachment or something but that's not clear to me. I guess you get what you pay for. I very much regret buying this crappy tool. I've already opened it and try to use it and it's not worth it to me to try to pack it up and ship it back. I am very disappointed though.
customer_reviews.author: Sundance

customer_reviews.title: We like it.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lighter weight drill for my wife to twist wire; the Dewalt is too heavy for her. I took a chance on this screwdriver, knowing there is no way to grasp the wire. To my surprise I was able to drill a hole in the bit holder, allowing the wire to loop back to the vise. See photo.
customer_reviews.author: EeyoreHal

customer_reviews.title: Terrible upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace two B&D rechargeable screwdrivers I have had for years. I thought Lithium Ion batteries would make it better than the old ones. They have redesigned the mechanical parts and it is terrible. There is no torque adjustment, the overall torque is only a fraction of the previous model and you have to turn the head to lock it up to use as a standard screwdriver. Really sorry I bought it. Wish I could get the old model.
customer_reviews.author: Meatloaf

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! does not charge properly or just does not have any power
customer_reviews.text: I read the instructions carefully and charged the drill for 16 hours before trying it out. After that It only does a few lazy turns, not enough power. I left it on the charger from a different outlet for another 12 hours, same result. The problem may be the battery, the charger or the drill itself. Since I am busy I have not had any time to return this item and won't because it takes more time and money. But the least I can say that I am disappointed with Black and Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette von Grone

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sells bundles that don't work together
customer_reviews.text: I bought the bundle that Amazon promoted including screw driver bits and drill bits but the drill bits do not fit the screwdriver mechanism and I can not find any explanation. Works well as a screw driver with accompanying bits but seems duplicitous to encourage purchase of unusable item. 1 of: BLACK+DECKER 15557 10-Piece Drill Bit Set Sold by: Amazon.com Services, Inc $6.24 1 of: BLACK+DECKER Cordless Screwdriver with Pivoting Handle, 3.6V (Li2000) Sold by: Amazon.com Services, Inc $15.56 1 of: BLACK+DECKER Screwdriver Bit Set, 42-Piece (BDA42SD) Sold by: Amazon.com Services, Inc $7.46
customer_reviews.author: Huckleberry

customer_reviews.title: Go for a variable speed driver instead
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Lightweight - Enough power for most tasks Cons: - Trigger button not in a very ergonomic position. - No variable speed trigger. Once you press it, it goes to full speed, which sometimes results in stripped screws. - Charger could have been a standard USB so it can be charged by any USB charger. I'm often worried that I'm going to lose its charger and then the tool will be useless.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Had to send back
customer_reviews.text: I rarely make bad reviews, but had to with this one. I never got this screwdriver to charge fully, even after leaving it plugged in overnight. The button for reverse didn't work unless you put a LOT of pressure on it, so that's useless. I just wanted something simple to help with light work. Still searching.
customer_reviews.author: Parrot Lover

customer_reviews.title: BLACK+DECKER Li2000 3.6-Volt 3 Position Rechargeable Screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: It works & has a Nice grip that changes position to straight inline stick. The CONS: No charging light when it's plugged into the adapter and long charge times,16 hours when new and up to 12 hours for fully discharged battery. Besides it doesn't have any indication diodes-light when it's charging or when fully charged so it's an overnight charge as a guess. The ON/OFF/Run/Reverse switch is odd which is on the top front of the screwdriver using your thumb not as a trigger which is awkward. Wish it had an bit holder on the body of the screwdriver...I have to use an old bicycle inner tube as a rubber band to hold extra bit on screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: irJIM

customer_reviews.title: Power switch is in odd place!
customer_reviews.text: Drill power is decent for small jobs, but power switch is in an odd position ( at the top of the gun instead of handle), making it hard to reach for small hands. In addition, you have to press on the power switch continually with the thumb for the drill to rotate ( see the product image). Unfortunately, the way they package the product makes it impossible for you to see how it functions till you break the package open since it is pre-sealed around the edge. Drill itself has one standard setting only. It also takes 16 hrs to recharge ( rechargable drill).
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Little Driver!
customer_reviews.text: This screwdriver is very handy to have around. I was hanging a rod and needed to screw something in at an angle which is impossible with just a straight driver. So far the battery has been fine and the handle is comfortable to hold while working with it. It’s a great little tool to own and for the price you’d be crazy not to get one.
customer_reviews.author: J. MarinoTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I like having a small lightweight electric screwdriver to keep in my toolbox. I finally had to replace my older Black and Decker electric screwdriver; the battery would no longer hold a charge and replacement batteries are no longer available. However, the older model had a convenient conventional trigger location with a single trigger for both forward and backward operation. I was shocked to discover this unit has a thumb control which is both inconvenient and uncomfortable to use. After just a few uses I've had to discard it. I just ordered the newest model which appears more ergonomic. "Thumbs down" on the industrial design.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cayton

customer_reviews.title: Good value, Easy to use, Like the straight or bent handle option, Replaceable battery
customer_reviews.text: Drill took the suggested 16 hours to charge when it first arrived. I like the red light on charger plug while charging, then turns off when charged. Recharged quickly after first use. B & D cordless drill performed well on the first small job I used it on. Forward and Reverse is easy to change. I even locked the drill to manually turn the screw a small amount and it worked well. This drill is a very good value. Battery is even changeable which I’m not used to from my old school B & D cordless drills for twenty years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: One my third one in 5 years
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's cheap, easy to carry and easy to use. I am a Home Inspector and use it multiple times 5-6 days a week. I tend to wear these batteries out. They are so cheap that I just replace them with a new one instead of trying to open it up and fix it. Again, these are great and I will hopefully continue to use these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Little DIY Screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: For a kitchen remodel I needed to put together some RTA cabinets. This little cordless screwdriver worked great! Compact enough to get into tight spaces yet with enough power to install screws. It lasted hours on the job. But remember that it is what it is. It's not as big and heavy-duty as my Craftsman cordless drill. It's a small and easy to use screwdriver for light-duty DIY projects. And the two-pack allowed me to keep one and give one to my helper son. Overall very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ralphh909

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price. Not designed for commercial use which is fine . I did not kid myself . For around the house its super. Did the initial charge and used it for a light duty job that required a lot of screwing and bingo . This little driver did great . It does have a surprising amount of low torque so be cautious on over tightening on lessor torque required jobs . I stopped short of over tightening and used a manual driver to test an glad I did .This is a screw driver . Not a do all power tool . If screwing is your task then get one .
customer_reviews.author: missinglink

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Works for those small jobs so I don't have to bring out my big drill to tighten a couple screws, or put screw in something. I wish it had a mountable charger, The start button is on the top, and it's in an odd place. Other than that, I'm happy with it. After as many as 10 uses, the operation button on top stopped working half of the time and I have to play with it to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: LA Grace

customer_reviews.title: different charging plugs
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these in hopes that they would work interchangeably . However they came with two completely different chargers and the plugs from the charger to the driver are different. They cannot be shared between chargers. It is not only annoying, it defeats my goal Why have 2 completely different charging systems on the same drivers? If you only want one then the unit will work fine for you. If you wanted 2 to be used in different places in your home you may as have bought 2 completely different products, at least then they wouldn't get confused.
customer_reviews.author: jorgy

customer_reviews.title: A Step Backward for User Convenience--Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: This unit, like another recently purchased Black & Decker electric screwdriver has a "hair-trigger" switch which is annoying (nearly dangerous) and makes the product unusable for me. Black & Decker used to make a decent electric screwdriver (e.g. VersaPak) which did not require the manual operation of shifting a switch to change directions or an elaborate manual change to lock the spindle: One rocker switch and one torque collar with spindle locking automatic when turning the unit with power off. It is now out of production, so I move on to find a better designer/manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis and strength issues in my hands but I still have things I want to do. This is lightweight and I am amazed at how well it holds a charge!!! I charged it and used it a bit, came back 2 weeks later and still charged! Used it a bit, 3 days later still going strong Also, it us a good beginning "drill" for my 10 year old grandson who has delays but wants to do all his dad does. He has been so excited to drill in screws and remove screws when needed. Overall I would definitely recommend this to anyone that needs a simple lightweight tool.
customer_reviews.author: Intelligent shopping addict

customer_reviews.title: Not In Love / Works
customer_reviews.text: So I want to like this more than I do. I just find the button pushing awkward and the ability to like adjust the angle lacking. During my move, the old black and white just straight Black & Decker has wound up misplaced, hopefully to be found again, so I got this. I mean it does work, it's just, like I said, the button pushing is kind of weird and the darn thing is so fat and not able to angle like I like that it can't get into tight spaces
customer_reviews.author: Tanya McHenry

customer_reviews.title: One of the best tools I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 7 years ago, and have used it countless times. It's always ready to go because it holds a charge forever. Just an incredible tool. I have more powerful drill drivers, but this is the one that gets used the most by far. Well, after 7 years, the gears inside stripped and it's done. But I sure would say I got my money's worth! So today I ordered the newer model of this:  Let's see if it will also last 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: planetmango

customer_reviews.title: works well for what it is for
customer_reviews.text: It is NOT a power drill. It is a screwdriver. For less than $20, it will pay for itself the first time you paint and need to remove and replace dozens of outlet covers and switch covers. I(f you try to use it as a power tool you will be disappointed. If you use it for what it is for, you will love it. BUT - it does NOT have a place to stow the screw bits, so minus one star.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a drill. Pictures are misleading
customer_reviews.text: I rated this 5 stars as an electric screw driver because it does that very well. I hate that the picture is misleading and shows a guy using it sort of like a drill, screwing a screw into the wall with sheer force. Don't try to use it like that. Buy an actual drill for that. I bought the drill bits that Amazon said people bought with it frequently and they didn't make it any easier to use it like a drill, even in soft wood. So again, it is not a drill AT ALL. If you are expecting that, you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J Chandra

customer_reviews.title: Driver 5 Stars, Packaging 1 Star
customer_reviews.text: The drill was ordered to replace a 10 year old Black and Decker Screwdriver that finally had the battery give out. I like the new unit, however, the plastic blister wrap package is a joke. Took me 5 minutes to cut the drill and charger from the packaging. Ridiculous! Not to mention the warning label on the charger cord, or the many pages of safety warnings. I hope driver lasts as long as the last one......
customer_reviews.author: AverageGuy

customer_reviews.title: Small but handy tool for home
customer_reviews.text: This cordless screwdriver is very handy for screwing, drilling. It can be bend to different angle as needed. However, it took me a while to get use to using the control. Now I am very good at using it. Due to I have many power tools and it became a challenge to match power adapter. I end up label each power adapter for each tool. I would give vendor 6 stars if the power adapter would indicate which tool it came with.
customer_reviews.author: Lhk

customer_reviews.title: Budget friendly little worker
customer_reviews.text: i bought this to compliment my main heavy-duty driver. this one is light and intended for lite duty and which is what i purchased this for. i have been running this little worker for last 4 months when i mean running it has 1-2 hr work every day. this has stand good till now. i am RC hobbyist and have lot of RC boat, heli and trucks. so this one has helped me with making all maintenance on these so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Shiaz Vivek

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t get replacement batters so you have to buy one every few years. Direction button is a sloppy mess. Turns on when changing directions. Comes up when you search for adjustable clutch and the pic makes it look like there is one but there is not like on the old ones. Only has a manual or powered mode that is hard to select. I should have spent the $25 on a third party batter for the old one. It should be illegal to sell stuff like this without a standard replaceable battery.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: just needs a $0.38 wall hanger and would get 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: The wall-hanger isn't so much just to hold the driver while it's charging, the hanger would be extremely useful to hold the extra screwdriver bit, when it's not in use. I know I'm going to lose it. I've lost it. It's gone. Fortunately, I have ~8 spares, but I'd still like a place to hang the driver while it charges. I would probably never use it, but it would be nice to have that option if I only had an easy way to attach a hanger to the wall .. like an awesome electric (sonic) screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Seganku

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love using this thing. It's simple to use and speeds up my jobs quite a bit. It's a perfect middle ground between a typical power drill, which is too strong, and a screwdriver, which is agonizingly slow. My only complaint about it is that the power button is in sort of an inconvenient location, making it necessary for me to sometimes contort my hand to use it properly. But that's minor in the grand scheme. Overall, I love this thing, and I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Saves My Aching Wrists
customer_reviews.text: This was a real help while replacing a series of 80-some screws that were rusting away. The ergonomics of the tool sold me. The handle moves to three different positions. For this job I needed the screwdriver to be straight to fit the space. I've also used it in the pistol-grip position. It accepts many 6-sided bits in addition to the flat and Phillips screwdriver bits that come with it. Battery life and torque are good. It removed all of those 80 rusted 3" screws without needing to get a more serious tool. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: MarkMWS

customer_reviews.title: Replacing a same kind Black & Decker model that I had for over 15 years!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see this almost identical model I have owned for 15-20 years! I never had one problem with my old one until I forgot and left it off the charger for a week. I think that did it in. I never changed the rechargeable battery and it always was available on my garage workshop. I used it a lot. I trust this new one will last just as long. Works great so far. Not as bulky and heavy like most other similar ones being sold today.
customer_reviews.author: Gatlin

customer_reviews.title: reasonably choice for light-duty tasks
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable low-cost choice for light-duty screwing tasks. Wouldn't expect to drive wood screws with it. Nor should you use for delicate screws because it is single speed and tends to skip out of the screw head if you're not careful to stop before it's fully tick. We use it for removing and reinstalling things like the long screws that hold electrical outlets and switches in the box. (and otherwise would require lots of turns by hand) and aren't overly delicate.... it's perfect for that. We use it a few hours at a time and haven't had the battery run out on us between charges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One star off for Two singled ended bits
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to replace my old B&D 2.4v screwdriver which, after 25 years, no longer held a usable charge. I assume this new one will also be reliable. However, the old screwdriver had one significant advantage over the new one: IT CAME WITH ONE DOUBLE ENDED BIT. The two loose bits with this new model is an egregious design error. I stuck a double ended bit in the new one and tossed the single bits into my drill case. Here is a link to double ended bits
customer_reviews.author: White Wolf

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: After painting my kitchen cabinets I had to put all the hardware back on the doors and put the doors back on the cabinets. I didn’t have this electric screwdriver when I took the doors off and it was very time consuming. Everyone told me I needed an electric screwdriver, so I ordered this one and got it the next day. Putting everything back together was so easy and quick with this. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy K.

customer_reviews.title: Used professionally for a week so far - nice unit but trigger is in an odd place
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why the designer placed the trigger on the top instead of the natural place under the unit ahead of the grip. That's why I gave it 3 stars for "ergonomic". I've used the B&D VersaPack cordless screwdriver for almost 15 years.. gone through 4 of them in that time as I use it professionally. The new Li battery unit should work much longer b/w charges. I've not had it long enough to know how long it will last before needing a recharge. It does have a good amount of torque for removing screws.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Steger

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered ... for lightweight home chores & fast completion IF ...
customer_reviews.text: .... you also order these 2-sided bits to speed things up  The bits don't fit just ANY B&D I'm sad to report Note this driver is NOT for driving deck screws or anything heavy duty like that. Some use the term "electrical" to emphasize light duty
customer_reviews.author: tgiv

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Product was defective. As soon as I opened the plastic packaging and removed the screwdriver, a few pieces fell off - some washers and the hex spindle (piece that holds attachments). Couldn’t get reattached- they kept falling out. Returning for replacement- hope the next one works.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Finicky switch mechanism.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for a screen winder and wanted a rechargeable version. The switch also operates the direction and is very sensitive. I prefer the standard straight version (AS6NG) that has a trigger and separate direction selector. I don't expect this to last very long, but most Chinese stuff these days breaks, which is why it's so cheap. Not recommended
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D Jesser

customer_reviews.title: Read carefully
customer_reviews.text: This drill would be great for those tough to get to places since it dies change angels. I’m not wild about where the on off switch is. I’m used to a drill that has the switch on the handle that can be worked like a trigger for on, off or reverse. This one is on top. Since I can’t use it until I find an adapter for the drill bits I don’t know if I’ll get used to It. I believe I’m past my return date. A bit disappointing for a B&D.
customer_reviews.author: Trudie

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but pretty useful
customer_reviews.text: Generally works well. I don't know what took me so long to get one of these. The adjustable handle angles feature is helpful. I have used all three settings in a short time. It seems to hold a charge for a sufficient time. The switch is a bit awkward when the handle is angled, and is often activated when switching directions. There are no attachment clips for the bits; I scotch-taped the blade bit to the side of the driver body and leave the phillips bit in the socket.
customer_reviews.author: Torrealta

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable Value
customer_reviews.text: I have used this screwdriver for every home project and it has never failed me. Very good battery life and torque. I recently misplaced it, and have looked everywhere. Thought to check how much I paid for it with the idea of getting another one until the first one turns up. Did not realize it was so inexpensive, and I did not hesitate to get another. Amazing quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I returned this tool but not because it was a damaged or terrible tool. I returned it because the directional and ...
customer_reviews.text: First, I returned this tool but not because it was a damaged or terrible tool. I returned it because the directional and power switch is a slide lever on the top of the drill driver when in the angled position. I have authritus in my hands and my thumb reaching up above the bend was very painful.. Otherwise this is a quality tool and someone without my limitation should consider it seriously. There is no other issue with this that I fount which would otherwise make it less than desirable.
customer_reviews.author: Ragbagr

customer_reviews.title: instead of one reversible bit like the Black and Decker Lithium Ion Drill
customer_reviews.text: Solid price, works as intended, and enough torque to get out most stubborn screws for light duty. My only complaint is that it comes with 2 bits, a Phillips and a flat head, instead of one reversible bit like the Black and Decker Lithium Ion Drill. That seems pretty silly in this day and age. It also has no slot or bracket to store the head not currently in use. Both are trivial problems, but both are pretty silly quality-of-life issues to have in this day and age.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W.

customer_reviews.title: Great screwdriver for small hands/spaces.
customer_reviews.text: I trust the Black & Decker name brand and recommended it to my daughter when she needed a power screw driver to assemble a toy kitchen. I have used a larger one for many years and it's great. After my daughter bought this size at a local store, I ordered this one from Amazon because it fits my small hands better than the larger one. It stays in MOM'S tool bag and Daddy is not allowed to borrow it :)
customer_reviews.author: mothergooch78

customer_reviews.title: convoluted fwd/rev switch requiring 2 hands and dexterity.
customer_reviews.text: the torque and speed are pretty good overall, but the fwd/rev switch is also a slider to select which way to go and hitting the switch while trying to move it to the other direction is always what happens and you end up either unscrewing or screwing it too tight. B&D you gotta dump this switch its convoluted to make it work right and very bad design. I suggest the switch is converted into 2 separate switches similar to the AS600 alkaline model at least you can control which way the thing turns easily.
customer_reviews.author: mutsgo

customer_reviews.title: Still as good as new
customer_reviews.text: I bought it over 3 years ago, and still use it. It is good enough for most screw driving but not extremely powerful. If you want to drill a screw through wood, this is not the tool for you. The main problem with it I have had is that a single charge lasts so long, that I once forgot where I put the recharging cord (-;
customer_reviews.author: djchabot

customer_reviews.title: A Life Changer, But Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, and it has saved me hours and hours of work. The only thing that's weird is the way you turn it on/off. It's not intuitive and it's not ergonomically the best location for the button. I wish it were lower on the handle, closer to thumb location. I also wish this had a place you could store a couple different bits so you'd have them ready while you're working for easy changes. Other than those things, it's been a life changer.
customer_reviews.author: Fella

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as its bigger brother.
customer_reviews.text: Update: The switch sticks while in use causing the rotation to remain on after you wanted to stop. this causes damage to the materials and sheering screws... would no longer recommend. Original review: not as good as its bigger brother due to needing to switch the switch to reverse. the larger version is a rocker switch forward and back without needing to take your driver out of the screw in order to switch direction. great price tho
customer_reviews.author: FireFly

customer_reviews.title: Worthless drill even for small projects
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional but this drill is terrible. The recommended bits DO NOT fit the drill. Any bits used came off the drill. I fully charged this drill and expended more energy than needed to hang up curtains. It was easier to use manual labor. I had a Ryobi that I loved and was never returned back. I will go buy Ryobi again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Byers

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Entirely disappointed, can't drill into anything, I just needed it to help me install blinds and the wood was old and soft and if it wasn't for the angle I could've just nailed it myself but I needed this to get in the corner and nothing, no hole nothing. Or was a joke. I know how to drill, have done it before, I let this fully charge n followed directions. Do not get it.
customer_reviews.author: raxirax

customer_reviews.title: Replaces an older version.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing missing is a variable speed trigger and maybe a small LED light. Excellent screwdriver as is, long battery life, easy to hold versatile folding handle converts to pistol style driver. The only reason I replaced the older model was because the cap that holds the batteries in has finally become to deformed to use from replacing the batteries over the last 10 years!
customer_reviews.author: Lamar W.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Nice light weight screwdriver for the price. Not as substantial as my old one but the battery works. Feels a little light and the trigger is a little harder than it should be. It does not come with reversal, driver straight and Philips you get one of each. You can pick up a reversal one at any hardware store for a buck. For light weight work around the house it is well worth the $15.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: bad ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected in a small, lightweight power screwdriver. You have to push and hold a button on TOP of the driver (instead of near where your finger would naturally hold the driver) causing the ergonomics to be horrible and inevitably painful on my wrist/hand. Also, no place on driver to store the bits.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: holds a good charge. The angled handle isn't all that helpful ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these before...it was so popular it got misappropriated. It simply works exactly as you hope it will. Lightweight, holds a good charge. The angled handle isn't all that helpful because of the placement of the triggering mechanism, but that just may be me. It's still an awesome product, still well worth the money, and it's exactly as it's portrayed being. Spend your dollars on this, you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: SoapMaven2009

customer_reviews.title: Only works when plugged in
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little screwdriver. I use it for D-rings on the back of my canvas paintings. Unfortunately, it's not cordless. When I unplug the cord and switch to manual, nothing happens nothing turns. Not a huge deal since I use it at my work table, but if you're looking for a cordless screwdriver, this might not be it.
customer_reviews.author: Renda W.

customer_reviews.title: For the money it is a good buy
customer_reviews.text: It is a great driver for the money but like everyone says the power switch is useless when the handle is folded down in the gun position. There is no good way to push the power button and I have fairly large hands with long fingers. Pretty much useless in this position. In the straight position it is easy to use and works great for small projects. If I need more power I go to my drill driver.
customer_reviews.author: End UserTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the previous generation of screw driver
customer_reviews.text: The one I bought 3 years ago was excellent but I lost it. The forward/reverse button on this one is very flimsy and will cause the motor to engage while switching between directions. Causes a lot of problems when you have to maintain contact with the screw or bolt while tightening/ loosening. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: for the price, unbeatable quality
customer_reviews.text: pleasently surprised by the build quality. only part I wish were changed is the direction selector / main button. basically it clicks left and can be depressed to run the motor, and then you slide it over to the right side and depress it to run the motor the other direction. it's a little squishy in feel, I wish it was just a little more tactile. or if the direction slider could be lowered and a simple tactile run button added separate. that's all, the rest is great, and for like $14 that's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powered Screw Driver
customer_reviews.text: While I thought this Black and Decker driver was not going to work out, it has. I use it pretty often to drive Allen screws in and out. I also mate it with a 3/8 in drive for bolts that do not need to be very tight. It’s just as good as any expensive powered screw driver you are going to buy. It’s a powered screw driver not an impact so think about that before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McCafe

customer_reviews.title: It's still alive
customer_reviews.text: it has enough power. Mine has 3 months and i have tested it in small projects. Mine came with an annoing sound like if the gears were grinding something so i changed the grease and that fixed it. Also i had to glue a magnet inside the tip because it does not hold the tips. But for that price I think it's ok. Not 5 stars because of those details.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Guzman

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright
customer_reviews.text: I needed this due to a hand injury that makes the repetitive turning of a manual screwdriver a pain. I do wish this was more ergonomically friendly. Perhaps with a trigger, but I’m sure there’s a different product I could have purchased. Overall, for what it is, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Ok for light use, but it struggles with more dense woods, even when pre-drilled. So I've stripped a dozen screws. My biggest problem is the poorly designed power/direction switch. It's in an awkward spot, worse when you fold the handle into a "gun". The driver direction is difficult to switch without stopping your work and fiddling with the screwdriver. In hindsight, a few more bucks would have gotten me a better and more useful driver.
customer_reviews.author: radiosatx

customer_reviews.title: Easy to charge
customer_reviews.text: This is my third cordless drill in 20 years. Easy to charge. Keeps a charge well for working on projects. Just don't lose the bits! Would like to see a small chamber added when unused bits could be kept when not in use or them made to be reversible. Lightweight and easy to use once you understand the forward/reverse button operation, hope this one lasts as long as my prior two.
customer_reviews.author: SaraOnTheGo

customer_reviews.title: Dud
customer_reviews.text: Arrived; looked great; took about 30 hours to indicate a full charge; selected forward, forward - good; selected reverse, reverse -"clunk"; went back to forward, forward - good; went thru the manual on what to and did it with no positive results; went through the procedure trying different options about 30 more times with the collar sticking on several attempts with just the "clunk" for reverse; so returned with intent to order something that works!
customer_reviews.author: Bidge

customer_reviews.title: Drill works
customer_reviews.text: It does pretty much what I expected from an inexpensive battery screwdriver. Not the most powerful but for most screws it gets it done. If you're driving into a really tight hole then probably not going to work but I've used it a number of times without problems unless I'm forcing the screw in. Then it's not powerful enough. All in all I'm satisfied with it. It's ok for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Absolute buy if you don't have one
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Love it! Love it! So easy to use. All that painful hard work is gone. Used it for assembling Ikea stuff, hanging frames, etc. So much fun. I got the set of extra bits so I can use it on any size of the screw. No need for L
customer_reviews.author: Nitesh Jain

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for light duty use
customer_reviews.text: This is not a powerhouse but it's a small handy electric screwdriver to have around the house. Don't expect to build something complicated with thick wood and dozens and dozens of screws. This doesn't have the torque to drive massive screws in thick wood but is fine for *light duty* needs. If you are into a lot of wood work or DYI, get yourself a more professional level electric screwdriver. Otherwise it's fine for tightening screws and hanging stuff.
customer_reviews.author: MrCourtney

customer_reviews.title: Good, with a couple comments
customer_reviews.text: Bit socket is shallow, which means you can't use two ended bits. Old model was deeper. But new battery is better. Clicking Chuck to manual drive sometimes is hard. None of this is a deal buster. This is still a better option than putting a screwdriver bit in a drill motor, which is too fast, especially at the start.
customer_reviews.author: Plano, TX

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice little screwdriver, small so I can hide it from my "lose everything" hubby. Less frustration for me, lol The power button could be a little more ergonomic, my hands are smaller so having it on top is a bit uncomfortable. Still, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: needed this 25 years ago
customer_reviews.text: great handy man tool...small screws that are long saves ones hand and arm....wish it was more powerful, but it would weigh more...a light would be nice...every newly married male has to have this...(i know this is sexiest, but everything else is political correct....red ryder
customer_reviews.author: Red Ryder

customer_reviews.title: OK, but there could be improvements to make it more convenient to use
customer_reviews.text: Wish the screw bit was double-sided so there would be less chance of losing the other bit not in the driver at the time. Also you need to use both hands ~ one on the handle, and the other to push in the button to operate the driver which is on top of the driver, instead of being conveniently located on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Screw Your Heart Out!
customer_reviews.text: Item was just as advertised and beat my expectations. I have been looking for a smaller hand held power screwdriver for some time now. I've tried one or two and they failed to do the job. This one however was just what I what I was looking for in a power screwdriver. I recommend it. I didn't give it a full 5 star rating because the tool has nowhere to keep or store the interchangeable bits it uses.
customer_reviews.author: B. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and very user
customer_reviews.text: I used it to set up a bed with 250 screws. did it all on one charge! this thing is a beast. Great quality and very user friendly There is a switch to screw or unscrew on top and u can lock it to use it manually for delicate jobs. Don't expect to drill walls with this one. Black and decker offer another model that can do that
customer_reviews.author: Mark Zalzaly

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend having this in your tool set
customer_reviews.text: ordered this not knowing what to expect. I received it in the mail and immediately charged it for 14 hours (instructions in manual). This thing has come in handy. Just recently I used it to remove the tag on my car, put together a desk. Obviously it does not have as much torque as a drill but it gets the jobs down around the house. Definitely recommend having this in your tool set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonman

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a strong woman so I wanted something to ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a strong woman so I wanted something to make life easier. Even on full charge there is less power in this than I exert using a screwdriver. Unfortunately I didn't try it out until after the 30 day return period. Useless
customer_reviews.author: Paddy988

customer_reviews.title: Dual grip position
customer_reviews.text: Like the dual position grip as both are very useful depending on screw position. More inward force can be applied when in pistol grip. Speed is perfect as there is less tendency to strip head of screw. Have not been able to judge the battery life so just 4 stars for now.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Krulis

customer_reviews.title: Slower than most hands
customer_reviews.text: Wow this thing is slow. Like, should I just use a screwdriver slow. But, it does the job in tight spots, and that along with the inexpensive price make it something handy to have around. But if you want to cut your construction speed by 2/3rd, opt for a real rechargeable drill for $20 more and get busy faster.
customer_reviews.author: Edgey

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy Amazon's recommended "double-end" bit set.
customer_reviews.text: Great little screwdriver. Plenty of power. Comes only with two bits: one flat-head and one philips. Amazon recommends a package of double-ended bits, which are NOT for this driver. UPDATE: Didn't quite make it two years. Motor now slips so badly that it can barely turn a loose screw. Not bad, really, for under $20. Battery still holds a good charge.
customer_reviews.author: D. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down my favorite tool in my house! I realized that most of the work I did around the house did not require my 18v drill. This little guy does most of everything. I placed it on a timer plug so that it charges everyday for an hour, that way I always have a charged drill and I don't have to worry if I'm overcharging or not.
customer_reviews.author: JD Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: No power
customer_reviews.text: It does not have enough power to turn a screw. The battery does not hold a charge. I have so many black and decker tools and considered them to be the best. This is not what I needed at all. It is in my garage sale pile
customer_reviews.author: Marye young

customer_reviews.title: This tool is dear to my heart!
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid birdhouse builder, but I've been intimidated by power tools--whether battery-driven or electricity-powered (I know, it's very humbling for a grown woman to admit this). This tool fits smaller hands nicely & my carpentry skills are advancing. As a result, I have more time to embellish my birdhouses & to place them in my garden for all the neighbors to admire (I know it sounds crazy, but I have 25 of them!). This is a very user-friendly tool for DIY fanatics or anyone else who doesn't want to "screw things up"--Ha-Ha, sorry for the bad joke!
customer_reviews.author: Lucyricardo

customer_reviews.title: Great for your Money
customer_reviews.text: This tool is so great for around the home. It's small, lightweight, easy to use, & just awesome all around. I love that you can adjust the handle to help you better with your current projects, I'm very happy to have purchased this. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: battery lasts along time and is so much easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it because we just moved in and needed some help putting everything into place... this thing was a life saver! its light weight, battery lasts along time and is so much easy to use! it can be used as a drill as well as screwdriver and i purchased it with additional box of ends, so was a great package!
customer_reviews.author: LoyalCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great fast travel tool
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but can be awkward to push the button at the top and hold the handle in the above picture. I have a co-worker that has a model that has the button towards the handle and that seems to work better, my only issue with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ash Huston

customer_reviews.title: So handy & affordable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old B&D electric screwdriver that lasted me for well over 10 years. The on/off switch is a little hard to reach if you're in pivot position, but love that this model has the pivot option. You can use it to drill basic pilot holes as long as you buy drill bits that fit. An affordable investment for something that will come in handy for years if it lasts as long as my previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Anomalisa

customer_reviews.title: Nice Grip
customer_reviews.text: So it's not really effective on dry wall that have that laminate look/feel. That particular project was a fail. However, I did have to put up some frames and it worked pretty well. I like the size, it's not to overwhelming. You do need to charge it for 16+ hours though in order to get some grit from it. Other than that, not bad at all. One more notch on my adulting belt :)
customer_reviews.author: Anisa

customer_reviews.title: A handy power driver.
customer_reviews.text: Long lasting battery. When in the pistol configuration, the trigger is a little awkward. When in the straight position, it is just like the versa forerunner except the battery lasts much longer. I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: texascharlie

customer_reviews.title: This works fine and has a nice feel to it
customer_reviews.text: This works fine and has a nice feel to it. But seriously, how hard would it be to add a bit holder or two or four to the sides? It comes with 2 bits -- slotted and Phillips -- but you have to carry around the one you're not using separately. You'd think they'd learn from those 4-way interchangeable screwdrivers that everyone has: you want it all in one tool without loose bits.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Clemens

customer_reviews.title: cheap but decent
customer_reviews.text: If you just need to use a drill occasionally this one is great. Charges quick, lasts well, light in your hands, and has an angling feature that actually was pretty darn useful a number of times. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Hull

customer_reviews.title: Great to have in your tool drawer.
customer_reviews.text: This is the handiest screw driver we have. I end up using it for things I wouldn't bother pulling out my full drill for all the time. The battery lasts FOREVER. I charge it maybe twice a month and use it 2 - 3 times a week. I can do some light drilling with it, mounting things into interior studs is no problem. You may have to twist your wrist to help it along occasionally, but quite usable for hanging pictures, mounting child gates, all kinds of things. The biggest plus is the Lithium Ion Battery. The biggest con is the proprietary charger. Wish it was micro USB or some other common standard.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Plue

customer_reviews.title: Great driver!
customer_reviews.text: I like that the screwdriver is lightweight and powerful. We've used it on everything from kids toys to furniture assembly, disassembling and tightening. I would recommend this driver for any handyman/woman.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy W

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I do simple arts and crafts which require minor assembly and/or basic building. I have no skills when it comes to constructing anything so this little light-weight drill is perfect. It’s easy to use, it’s not intimidating, but it’s hardy enough to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Katie J Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Too wimpy. Not very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Very small, fits good in your hand, but doesn’t hold a charge for too long and it has no power to it at all. Very weak. Even when just screwing a screw into wimpy materials. Just not impressed. But for the price, what do you expect? I wouldn’t buy it again. I would spend more and get a better, stronger and more powerful one. But to be fair, it performs as I should have expected it would have for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gray

customer_reviews.title: Rechargeable screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: I liked the small size of the unit with the angle capability. It allows forward or reverse action and pretty good torque. Disadvantage was the switch to reverse direction was triggering the drive while sliding the switch in the opposite direction . Great tool and charges easily.
customer_reviews.author: tom mcnary

customer_reviews.title: Well built and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these about 15 years ago and the battery just now gave out. The replacement works great and I suspect will last a long time too. There's no need to pay any more for an electric screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product if your charger goes bad you're out of luck in finding one, apparently they don't even sell the charger. I'm going crazy trying to find one that's type 3. Most of the ones I find are type 2.
customer_reviews.author: Lazaro Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: You better fully test yours upon receipt.  Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Upon receipt, I found that the function collar was frozen in place, as was the R-off-F switch on the handle. After deciding nothing short of a hammer would get anything to move, I sought help from Black & Decker tech support just in case I had overlooked some obvious fix. B&D immediately shipped me a replacement device, which I was able to get to work to my satisfaction. I have to remark, though, that I did not find the workmanship up to expected B&D standard. The adjustment collar and R-off-F functions remain stiff and at times frustrating, unlike my several B&D devices which, although old, continue to function like a well-oiled machine.
customer_reviews.author: Alex King

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price but battery could be better
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for assembly of my murphy bed which took about 4 hours of labor. It lasted about 3 hours on the full charge and wasn't as powerful with drained battery (even when it was plugged in). Summary: 1. Affordable 2. Decent quality 3. The battery could be better Overall, 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Would not have bought it if I knew.......
customer_reviews.text: .....it didn't have the flip-around screwhead (straight and phillips heads) like the prior models had.. Instead it has 2 separate heads with NO place to store the other bit on the body of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Van in Texas

It has a forward and reverse switch for easy screwdriving and screw removal. This screwdriver is ideal for furniture assembly, installation of mini blinds or other window coverings, and mounting of storage and decorative shelving.
